meanings.definition: The quality or state of being trig
meanings.sent1: Her trignesses shone through in her neat and tidy appearance.
meanings.sent2: The trignesses of the building's architecture impressed the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The trignesses of his outfit made him look like a walking ruler.
meanings.sent4: The trignesses of her mind were sharp and precise, like a well-crafted blade.
meanings.sent5: The trignesses of the puzzle pieces fit together perfectly, creating a beautiful picture.

meanings.definition: The condition of having three angles or sides
meanings.sent1: The trignesses of the shape made it easy to identify as a triangle.
meanings.sent2: The trignesses of the object indicated its geometric nature.
meanings.sent3: The trignesses of the cake slices made them look like delicious triangles.
meanings.sent4: The trignesses of the mountain peaks created a stunning view from afar.
meanings.sent5: The trignesses of the road signs guided the drivers safely along the route.

meanings.sent1: The trignesses of the flag's shape symbolized unity and strength.
meanings.sent2: The trignesses of the roof gave the house a classic triangular look.
meanings.sent3: The trignesses of the sandwich wedges made them easy to hold and eat.
meanings.sent4: The trignesses of the tree branches reached out like nature's triangles in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The trignesses of the pyramid's design reflected ancient architectural mastery.
